result.title: Feature Request: Browsing Blog Posts through pages
result.content:
Codeforces contains so many nice blog posts about data structure, algorithm, problem solving techniques, brilliant idea, own experience, knowledge sharing, good materials, links, tutorials etc. Besides, sometimes many post asking for help on any algorithm, data structure or any specific problem, where many replies and give brilliant idea or hints, by which many people get help and learn many new things and get many new idea or techniques.

But we always miss many of them, since we can only see some posts in the "Recent actions" and we can't browse or see any old post directly.

So, we will be benefited if codeforces provide us a new feature: "Browsing blog posts by pages" For example, we can browse contests by this link: http://codeforces.com/contests and go through all the pages by http://codeforces.com/contests/page/2 , http://codeforces.com/contests/page/3, and so on.

Similarly, we can browse problem pages by this link: http://codeforces.com/problemset And go through all the pages by http://codeforces.com/problemset/page/2 , http://codeforces.com/problemset/page/3, and so on.

Similarly, if we would be able to browse all the blog pages, something like http://codeforces.com/blogs and go through all the pages by http://codeforces.com/blogs/page/2 , http://codeforces.com/blogs/page/3 and so on, then, we never miss any good blog post on codeforces and we all will be benefited by the posts.

So, I request to codeforces authority to think about this feature and add this feature in codeforces. Please consider it ... Thanks in advance.
